ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about statistical mechanics and electromagnetism.
I learned about statistical mechanics and electrodynamics.
We spent half of the semester on Stat mech and half on E&M. Overall a very brief but rigorous introduction to these topics.
Learned an overview of statistical mechanics and electrodynamics as well as how to solve Laplace equations using differential equations
I learned about statistical mechanics, electrostatics, magnetostatics, and electrodynamics, as well as a variety of methods to solving problems within these topics.
I learned statistical mechanics and electromagnetism.
Yes! I learned a lot in this class this semester -- the content was well organized and Professor Padmanabhan is an engaging lecturer.

How to work in the canonical, micro canonical and grand canonical ensembles. For E&M we learned how to solve for potential, vector potential and the electric field of finite and infinite charged objects.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think this class is very well-organized and very well-taught. The lectures were very engaging and very helpful to my understanding. Moreover, there were plenty of office hours that were incredibly helpful. I only wish that the professor would post lecture notes on Canvas so that if I couldn't understand something from my notes, I could reference the lecture notes to see what I missed.

Strengths: take-home midterm/final was really nice for a math major, and Professor P is very very strong. Weakness: I'm not sure if I have the higher-level understanding of the material since I didn't take PHYS 180/181 (but that's on me)
Strengths: great instructor that is very clear and knowledgeable and engaging in lecture. Professor P really cares about his students. Weaknesses: its hard to master the material just from hw.
Professor P is definitely the strength of the course. He is very engaging and his office hours are very helpful.

Strengths: good overview of both SM and EM. I felt like I have a good sense of both topics, and I only had to take one class to learn them. The class moves quickly, but it's doable. Professor Padmanabhan is an excellent lecturer. The homework is difficult but doable, as well. It builds very nicely off of the course material. Problem sets graded quickly.
Weaknesses: there were jumps in logic and shorthand notations that made it tough to follow lecture.

Strengths: Professor P. is very knowledgeable and very helpful. The course was well structured. The PSETs helped me learn the material. Navya, our TA was great as well.
Weaknesses: can't think of any at the moment. There was a lot of information crammed into the last class, but this is hard to time perfectly.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This class helped me understand E&M in a way that I never could before. The professor is wonderful and very engaging. Both the lectures and the office hours helped me immensely. Moreover, both exams were take-home and non-cumulative (the first midterm was after the statistical mechanics portion of the class, and the final only covered electricity and magnetism), which I think, especially for physics, is the best way to test student learning. The only issue I had was that for the final exam, the exam was open for two and a half days during the end of final exam period (one of the days was the day the final exam was officially scheduled for), which was more than enough time to complete it, but felt a little bit unfair as I had three other exams during that time frame that I needed to study for and complete while other people could focus only on this for the entire period. I still had plenty of time to complete the exam though.
Yes
Yes! For majors this is a great course and probably my favorite so far in the major.

I wouldn't necessarily recommend this class to any non-physics majors, as it's definitely not the most interesting physics elective you could take. If you're a physics major you don't really have a choice, other than 430.
Yes! SM and EM are fundamental to how we understand the world, and this class builds an understanding of both topics. Professor Padmanabhan teaches the material well.
Yes, mostly if you're majoring in Math, Physics, APHY or ASTR. If you aren't, and want to take it, it's great class with Prof. P. Make sure you have the math background.
